io.vertx.core

Class ServidorOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.core.ServidorOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ServidorOptions
extends Object
implements Serializable

    「Co」Vert.x Extension

    This class is Options architecture for RPC ( Default implementation is gRpc ), it provide the configuration for micro service communication. This class should be used in Micro Service Application instead of standalone web application here. In zero framework, the default service communication components is implemented with gRpc.

    Here are yaml structure in vertx-server.yml:

    vertx-server.yml

    // <pre><code class="yaml">
 server:
   - name: ipc-datum
     type: ipc
     config:
         jks: "ipc/ssl/rpc-server-keystore.jks"
         password: "wibble"
         port: 7104
         host: 0.0.0.0
// </code></pre>

    This configuration is specific and you must define it in vertx-server.yml file instead of other files, the server will be configured in lime extension internally. Here the name will be used out of current component, I recommend to use ipc prefix in name attribute in zero framework, the name will be written to registry configuration center ( In zero framework the default implementation is etcd3 ).

    The config options is for RPC server:

    1. RPC server host and port, the port must be different from http server port, the host 0.0.0.0 means wildly used.
    2. jks and password defined the communication mode of SSL here, when you defined ssl mode, each client must be over the same SSL cert.
    Author:
    lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Integer DEFAULT_PORT
      Default port, 6084 It defined RPC server default port, this port is public because RPC client will use this attribute as default port.
